intro: Echinacanthus madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starfish plant, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves and showy blue or violet blossoms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
